Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler

Interface ClientHelloState

  • public interface ClientHelloState
    Operations available after receiving the server greeting.

    This interface is provided to the handler in ServerGreeting.handleGreeting(java.lang.String, boolean, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler.ClientHelloState) and allows the handler to initiate the SMTP session with either EHLO or HELO.

    Use EHLO for Extended SMTP (recommended for modern servers) or HELO as a fallback for servers that don't support ESMTP. The esmtp parameter in handleGreeting indicates whether the server advertised ESMTP support.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    ServerGreeting.handleGreeting(java.lang.String, boolean, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler.ClientHelloState)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void ehlo​(java.lang.String hostname, ServerEhloReplyHandler callback)
      Sends an EHLO command to initiate an Extended SMTP session.
      void helo​(java.lang.String hostname, ServerHeloReplyHandler callback)
      Sends a HELO command to initiate a basic SMTP session.
      void quit()
      Closes the connection without establishing a session.

    • Method Detail

      • ehlo

        void ehlo​(java.lang.String hostname,
          ServerEhloReplyHandler callback)
        Sends an EHLO command to initiate an Extended SMTP session.

        EHLO is the preferred command for modern SMTP servers and enables extensions like STARTTLS, AUTH, PIPELINING, and SIZE.

        Parameters:
        hostname - the client's hostname to announce
        callback - receives the server's response

      • helo

        void helo​(java.lang.String hostname,
          ServerHeloReplyHandler callback)
        Sends a HELO command to initiate a basic SMTP session.

        HELO is used as a fallback when EHLO is not supported. No extensions will be available.

        Parameters:
        hostname - the client's hostname to announce
        callback - receives the server's response

      • quit

        void quit()
        Closes the connection without establishing a session.

        Use this to abort immediately after receiving the greeting if the server is not acceptable (e.g., wrong server, policy violation).
